intro.option: ADMINISTRATION HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ONE HUNDRED FIFTEENTH CONGRESS FIRST SESSION __________ MARCH 8, 2017 __________ Printed for the use of the Committee on House Administration Available on the Internet: www.gpoaccess.gov/congress/house/administration/index.html _________ U.S. GOVERNMENT PUBLISHING OFFICE 25-186 WASHINGTON : 2017 ____________________________________________________________________ For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Publishing Office, Internet:bookstore.gpo.gov. Phone:toll free (866)512-1800;DC area (202)512-1800 Fax:(202) 512-2104 Mail:Stop IDCC,Washington,DC 20402-001 Committee on House Administration GREGG HARPER, Mississippi, Chairman RODNEY DAVIS, Illinois, Vice ROBERT A. BRADY, Pennsylvania, Chairman Ranking Member BARBARA COMSTOCK, Virginia ZOE LOFGREN, California MARK WALKER, North Carolina JAMIE RASKIN, Maryland ADRIAN SMITH, Nebraska BARRY LOUDERMILK, Georgia
intro.paragraph: The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 10:53 a.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [Chairman of the Committee] presiding.
intro.hearing-info: Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Smith, Loudermilk, Brady, and Raskin.
intro.paragraph: Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Bob Sensenbrenner, General Counsel; Max Engling, Franking Director; George Hadijski, Director of Member Services; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggard, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Cole Felder, Counsel; Alex Attebery, Staff Assistant; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk.
The Chairman. I now call to order the Committee on House

Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Senior Advisor; Bob Sensenbrenner, General Counsel; Max Engling, Franking Director; George Hadijski, Director of Member Services; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; C. Maggie Moore, Legislative Clerk; Rob Taggard, Deputy Legislative Clerk/Oversight; Cole Felder, Counsel; Alex Attebery, Staff Assistant; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Matt Pinkus, Minority Senior Policy Advisor; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's Committee markup. A quorum is present. So we may proceed. The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so Members may submit any materials they wish to be included therein.

Today we will consider H. Res. 173, the Committee Funding Resolution which authorizes the committee budgets for the 115th Congress. Every Congress, the House looks to this Committee to carry out our responsibility of determining the funding needed for standing House committees this year and next. Our panel has received input from the chairmen and ranking members of each standing committee to help set appropriate funding levels. I thank each of them for presenting a budget request that is targeted to meet their legislative and oversight responsibilities. I am confident that, with their assistance, our Committee has put forward a funding resolution that applies appropriate and targeted amounts to effectively support each of the House committees as they continue their work.
I would now like to recognize the Committee's Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement if he wishes.
intro.speaker: Mr. Brady

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: Thank you, Mr. Chairman. Thank you for calling this meeting this morning.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: And I am pleased to support the Committee Funding Resolution. I will ask my colleagues to do same.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: I also appreciate your bipartisan approach to this process, working with me to protect the rights of the minority. On behalf of my colleagues on the Armed Services Committee, the increase is very much needed, and it will be put to good use. I hope we are able to take this matter to the floor quickly and get our colleagues the resources they need.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: You know, we hear from every one of our ranking members and our chairmen, and all they keep saying is they have to get qualified staff. We need qualified staff all around this country. And in order to get qualified staff, you have got to pay them. And we don't pay them nowhere near the level that they would get paid in private service in the private sector. So we appreciate, you know, their contribution to the American people, and we appreciate the contribution to this here. And I think that most of them--almost all of them--have said that any increase would be going to staff and getting and keeping qualified staff, so they don't leave, and being able to attract qualified staff. So I think it is a good approach that we are doing a little bit and a little bit more, a little bit more, and maybe we can maintain and keep that level.

paragraph.speaker: Mr. Brady

intro.paragraph: Thank you, Mr. Chairman. I yield back the balance of my time.
intro.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back
The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: I would ask if any other Member of the Committee wishes to be recognized for the purpose of providing an opening statement.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Seeing none, I now call up and lay before the Committee H. Res. 173, the Committee Funding Resolution.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Without objection, the first reading of the Resolution is dispensed with, and the Resolution is considered read and open for amendment at any point.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [The bill follows:]

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: The Chairman. Is there any debate?

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [The bill follows:]

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Are there any Members that want to offer an amendment to the Resolution?

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Seeing none, I move the Committee favorably report H. Res. 173.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: The question is on the motion.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: All those in favor, signify by saying aye.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Any opposed, by nay.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it and the motion is agreed to.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Without objection, the markup is adjourned.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: Thanks.

paragraph.speaker: The Chairman. The gentleman yields back

intro.paragraph: [Whereupon, at 10:56 a.m., the Committee was adjourned.]
